organization.fullName: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Improve Outcomes for Older Allogeneic Transplant Recipients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intervening on Frailty to Improve Outcomes for Older Allogeneic Transplant Recipients

leadSponsor.name: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is an interventional pilot study to determine whether implementation of a supervised exercise program can improve outcomes in subjects undergoing allogeneic HCT. The primary objective is to determine feasibility. Up to 60-72 evaluable subjects will be enrolled. Evaluable subjects are defined as those participating in the exercise intervention.

armGroups.label: Cohort A (Prehab)
armGroups.description: Pre-frail and frail subjects will attend at least twice weekly exercise sessions with a physical therapist and be given an exercise program to complete at home prior to admission for HCT. Patients enrolled in this cohort can continue on to Cohort B.

armGroups.label: Cohort B (Rehab)
armGroups.description: All patients 60 years and older upon discharge from their initial hospital stay for HCT will attend at least weekly exercise sessions with a physical therapist and be given an exercise program to complete at home with sessions continued through Day +100 after HCT.

interventions.name: Exercise Program (Cohort A Prehab)
interventions.description: Pre-frail and frail potential HCT recipients 60 years and older will participate in a supervised exercise program from the time of enrollment up until HCT admission. Exercise compliance will be measured in part through physical activity trackers.from time of discharge from HCT until day +100 post-HCT. All HCT recipients 60 years and older will participate in a supervised exercise program from the time of discharge from HCT admission until day +100 post-HCT. Exercise compliance will be measured in part through physical activity trackers.

interventions.name: Exercise Program (Cohort B Rehab)
interventions.description: All HCT recipients 60 years and older will participate in a supervised exercise program from the time of discharge from HCT admission until day +100 post-HCT. Exercise compliance will be measured in part through physical activity trackers.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of enrolled subjects who participate in the supervised exercise program
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From 3 months prior to HCT to 100 days after HCT

primaryOutcomes.measure: Median number of exercise sessions delivered pre-HCT and post-HCT.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From 3 months prior to HCT to 100 days after HCT

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented discharge from the hospital, assessed up to 100 months
From time of discharge from initial hospital stay up through 1-2 years after HCT
From day 0 of HCT to 6 months and 1-year] 6. 1-year and 2-year OS
From day 0 of HCT to 1-year and 2-years
From day 0 of HCT to 1-year and 2-years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Cohort A (Prehab)

1. Age 60 years or older.
2. Planned allogeneic HCT in the next 1-6 months.
3. Hematological malignancy as the indication for HCT.
4. Pre-frail or frail by Fried frailty phenotype.

Cohort B (Rehab)

1. Age 60 years or older.
2. Planned allogeneic HCT or HCT within the last 30 days.
3. Hematological malignancy as the indication for HCT.

Exclusion Criteria:

Cohorts A and B

1. Comorbid disability or illness that prevents safe exercise.
